scripts.test-browser: browserify <% if (props.isEs6) { %>-t babelify<% } %> test/test<%= props.extension %> | tap-closer | smokestack -b chrome | tap-spec
scripts.test: npm run test-server && npm run test-browser
scripts.tdd-server: nodemon -x npm -i node_modules/ -e js,<%= props.extension.replace('.', '') %> -- run -s test-server
scripts.tdd-browser: hihat test/*<%= props.extension %> <% if (props.isEs6) { %>--transform babelify<% } %> --debug -p tap-dev-tool

scripts.test: browserify <% if (props.isEs6) { %>-t babelify<% } %> test/*<%= props.extension %> | tap-closer | smokestack -b chrome | tap-spec
scripts.tdd: smokestack-watch test/*<%= props.extension %> <% if (props.isEs6) { %>-t babelify<% } %> | tap-spec
nodemon -x npm -i node_modules/ -e js,<%= props.extension.replace('.', '') %> -- run -s test

scripts.note1: we can't have nice things. prepublish also runs on npm install https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/6394 in-publish hacks around this
scripts.prepublish: in-publish && npm prune && npm run -s gitPush || in-install
scripts.note2: eslint will always pull from the global eslintrc file, disable that so that we're only looking at the local
scripts.note3: travis doesn't play nicely with !#/bin/bash in the script file, so we have to explicitly set bash
scripts.note4: the diff-filter option below gets all files but deleted ones
scripts.lint-staged: git diff --diff-filter=ACMRTUXB --cached --name-only | grep '.*\<%= props.extension %>\|\.js$' | grep -v 'node_modules' | xargs npm run -s lint
scripts.dmn: dmn gen -f . && if [[ $(git diff --shortstat 2> /dev/null | tail -n1) != '' ]]; then git add .npmignore && git commit --no-verify -m'update npmignore'; fi
scripts.doctoc: doctoc README.md && if [ -f CONTRIBUTING.md ]; then doctoc CONTRIBUTING.md; fi && if [[ $(git diff --shortstat -- README.md 2> /dev/null | tail -n1) != '' || $(git diff --shortstat -- CONTRIBUTING.md 2> /dev/null | tail -n1) != '' ]]; then git add README.md CONTRIBUTING.md && git commit --no-verify -m'table of contents update'; fi
scripts.release: f () { source ./scripts.sh && npm run requireGitClean && npm run gitPull && npm run dmn && npm run doctoc <% if (props.isEs6) { %>&& npm run build-es5 <% } %>&& npm run lint && npm test && npm_release <%= publicness %> $@; }; f

config.notes: important to correct the path of npm so that the git hook doesn't error

ghooks.pre-push: PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin && npm run dmn && npm run doctoc && npm run lint && npm test
